content: First, follow the official Tailwind v4 upgrade guide. Then, upgrade your HeroUI version using your package manager (e.g., `pnpm up @heroui/react`).

Tailwind v4 uses a CSS-first approach where `tailwind.config.js` is not required. You need to create a `hero.ts` file to export the heroui plugin and update your main CSS file to import Tailwind's CSS files.
For backward compatibility, `tailwind.config.js` is still supported. You can explicitly load it in your configuration if you need to keep it.
In v3, `tailwindcss` was a PostCSS plugin. In v4, this is now in the `@tailwindcss/postcss` package. `autoprefixer` is no longer required as prefixing is handled automatically.
For Vite projects, you need to update your `vite.config.ts` to use the new `@tailwindcss/vite` plugin instead of the old PostCSS setup.
After migrating, verify that styles are applied correctly and the build process completes without errors. If you need help, join the Discord community or open an issue on GitHub.
